head.title: June 18-24; Signs of Water on Mars

hedline.hl1: June 18-24; Signs of Water on Mars

block.p: Mars used to have oceans and rivers, but they vanished more than a billion years ago, the water evaporating and escaping into space. Scientists believed that what little water remained was trapped in the planet's frozen poles.

Mars used to have oceans and rivers, but they vanished more than a billion years ago, the water evaporating and escaping into space. Scientists believed that what little water remained was trapped in the planet's frozen poles.

Now, pictures taken by an orbiting American spacecraft suggest there may be underground sources of water beneath the upper crust that occasionally burst free and flow down crater walls. Scientists think those may be ideal places to seek evidence of life.
